noscript.div: You may be trying to access this site from a secured browser on the server. Please enable scripts and reload this page.

div.div:
Parents and Guardians,
We know this is a difficult time for all, and that you might be struggling to balance work/finances, child care, and self care while trying to adjust to the current state of normal. Please know that while they may not be coming to see us every day, we are still here to support our students.
Below, you will find the names of our Director of Special Servies, District Psychologist, Social Workers, and Guidance Counselors. Please feel free to contact them at any time. We also encourage you to use the following websites to assist with conversations between you and your student(s) regarding COVID-19.
Helping Children Cope with Changes Resulting From COVID-19 – National Association of School Psychologists
Supporting Families During COVID-19 – Child Mind Institute
Coronavirus Resources for Kids, Parents, and Educators – Whole Child Counseling
Talking to Children About Coronavirus Disease – Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Food Assistance and Essential Services​ - Provided by Will County Covid-19 Response
District Support Contacts
Carrie Hill, District Director of Special Services
